div.div: ʽ ʽβράχω ʼ , aor. ἔβραχε, βράχε: clash, crack, bray, (a word whose applications are difficult to reconcile); of armor, an axle, Il. 5.838; the earth (cf. ‘crack of doom’), Il. 21.387; a river, Il. 21.9; a door, Il. 21.49; the wounded Ares, Il. 5.859, 863 a horse, Il. 16.468.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
